description: Change of use from Retail Unit (Use Class A1) to Residential dwelling house (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: The proposal would involve the loss of an existing retail store (Use Class A1) and employment use at the site. No  robust evidence has been submitted to indicate that the premises has been actively marketed, and that the existing use or an alternative employment use is no longer viable. The proposal would therefore be contrary to National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Policies DM17 and DM19 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The loss of the shop front from this prominent location on Bloomfield Road and the erection of front boundary treatment of a domestic appearance would  be highly incongruous and have a significant adverse impact on the character and appearance of the host building and the surrounding Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012)
Condition 80 (Renewable Energy Strategy) - Officers have reviewed the information submitted and are satisfied this can now be approved.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 80 (Renewable Energy Strategy) for planning permission 16/10482/FUL is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.
The submitted Floor Plans do not show the direction of North. As this is a requirement for Floor Plans, please review and amend the plans to add a North point.
We do not accept land registry location plan, please revise the location plan to show the red outline in the proposed site including the front pavement, where drop kerb will be proposed.
